p: Sorghum ( Sorghum bicolor), a cereal grain, is the one of the important cereal crops ( https://sorghumgrowers.com/2011/07/21/ten-things-you-may-not-know-about-sorghum/). It is drought tolerant and versatile as food, feed and fuel. In the United States food usage of sorghum is on the rise as it is gluten-free ( Thomson 2017). World production of sorghum in 2020 is estimated to be 60 million metric tons. Major sorghum production counties in million metric tons are USA 8.9, Nigeria 6.9, Ethiopia 5.2, Mexico 4.5, India 4.4, China 3.6, and Argentina 2.4 ( http://www.worldagriculturalproduction.com/crops/sorghum.aspx).
